overview: Microsoft Corporation is a global technology company that develops, manufactures, licenses, supports, and sells computer software, consumer electronics, personal computers, and related services. It is known for its Windows operating systems, Office suite, Azure cloud services, and Xbox gaming consoles.
mission_values: To empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.
Create a future that benefits everyone.
products_services: Productivity and Business Applications (Microsoft 365 including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, OneDrive)
business_model: Subscription services (Microsoft 365, Azure, Xbox Game Pass, LinkedIn Premium)
interview_focus: Technical expertise in data structures and algorithms
Coding skills (often on platforms like Codility)
System design (more for full-time, but basic understanding can be a plus for interns)
Behavioral questions assessing alignment with company values and teamwork
interview_process: Online coding test (typically 2 questions, around 100 minutes, focusing on data structures and algorithms).
Multiple rounds of technical interviews (often 1-2 for interns) focusing on coding, problem-solving, and potentially some design questions.
Behavioral questions are integrated into technical rounds or as a separate discussion.

recent_news.title: Microsoft and FFA help students use smart sensors and AI to learn about the future of farming and technology
recent_news.summary: Microsoft partnered with FFA to help students learn about agricultural technology using smart sensors and AI, highlighting the company's focus on education and AI applications.

recent_news.title: Microsoft Cloud and AI strength drives third quarter results
recent_news.summary: Microsoft reported strong third-quarter earnings, primarily driven by the growth and performance of its Cloud and AI segments, indicating continued investment and success in these areas.

recent_news.title: Microsoft pledges $50 billion to tackle AI inequality as it warns of a ‘growing divide’
recent_news.summary: Microsoft announced a significant investment of $50 billion to address AI inequality, acknowledging the potential for a growing divide in access and benefits from artificial intelligence.
